history.proof: intros n l H1 H2. destruct n. - left. exists 0. shelve. - right. exists O, (S n), O, O. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment l : list (nat * nat) H1 : is_wf l H2 : 0 > 0 Unable to unify "power 0 0" with "refactor l".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (n : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), is_wf l -> n > 0 -> {x : nat | refactor l = power x n} + {p : nat & {q : nat & {r : nat & {k : nat | is_prime p /\ 0 < r /\ r < n /\ refactor l = power p (q * n + r) * k /\ rel_prime p k}}}}

Premises:
refactor = fix refactor (l : list (nat * nat)) : nat := match l with | nil => 1 | (p, n) :: tail => power p n * refactor tail end : list (nat * nat) -> nat Arguments refactor _%list_scope
Inductive is_wf : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_wf : is_wf nil | cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_wf _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_wf (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope
power = fix power (x n : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => x * power x n0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments power (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
is_prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall d : nat, divides p d -> d = 1 \/ d = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments is_prime _%nat_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
rel_prime = fun a b : nat => is_gcd 1 a b : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%nat_scope
nat_factor_prime : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> n <> 1 -> {p : nat & {m : nat & {q : nat | is_prime p /\ m > 0 /\ n = power p m * q /\ is_gcd 1 p q /\ q < n}}}
euclide : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | a = b * q + r /\ r < b}}
is_factorisation = fun (n : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)) => is_wf l /\ n = refactor l : nat -> list (nat * nat) -> Prop Arguments is_factorisation _%nat_scope _%list_scope
in_wf : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (p n : nat), In (p, n) l -> is_wf l -> is_prime p /\ n > 0
factorisation : forall n : nat, {l : list (nat * nat) | is_wf l /\ n = refactor l} + {n = 0}
not_prime_impl_prime_divides : forall n : nat, ~ is_prime n -> {p : nat | is_prime p /\ divides n p} + {n = 1}
divides_nat : forall n : nat, {p : nat | p <> 1 /\ p <> n /\ divides n p} + {forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> p <> n -> ~ divides n p}
nat_factor : forall n p : nat, is_prime p -> n <> 0 -> {m : nat | divides n (power p m) /\ ~ divides n (power p (m + 1))}
factorisation_unique_upto_perm : forall l l' : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> is_wf l' -> refactor l = refactor l' -> is_permutation (nat * nat) l l'
prime_power_divides_refactor : forall (p n m : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf l -> divides (refactor l) (power p n) -> In (p, m) l -> n <= m
is_wf_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> Prop, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> P tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> P l
is_wf_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> SProp, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> P tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> P l
bezout_exists : forall a b : nat, {u : nat & {v : nat | is_gcd (a * u - b * v) a b}} + {u : nat & {v : nat | is_gcd (b * v - a * u) a b}}
prime_divides_refactor : forall (p : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> is_wf l -> divides (refactor l) p -> exists m : nat, In (p, m) l
factorisation_unique_upto_equiv_aux : forall l l' : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> is_wf l' -> refactor l = refactor l' -> forall x n : nat, In (x, n) l -> In (x, n) l'
factor_divides_refactor : forall (x : nat * nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), In x l -> divides (refactor l) (power (fst x) (snd x))
cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail)
Inductive is_wf : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_wf : is_wf nil | cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_wf _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_wf (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope
power_lt : forall p m : nat, 1 < p -> 0 < m -> 1 < power p m
rel_prime_wf : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (p n q m : nat), In (p, n) l -> is_wf ((q, m) :: l) -> rel_prime p q
divides_prime : forall a : nat, (exists p : nat, p <> a /\ is_prime p /\ divides a p) -> ~ is_prime a
is_cd = fun d a b : nat => divides a d /\ divides b d : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_cd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
f = fun x : nat * nat => fst x + snd x : nat * nat -> nat
wf_impl_pwd : forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> is_pwd l
pwd_impl_set : forall l : list (nat * nat), is_pwd l -> is_set (nat * nat) l
mult_lt_compat_r : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> 0 < p -> n * p < m * p
is_gcd = fun d a b : nat => is_cd d a b /\ (forall d' : nat, is_cd d' a b -> divides d d') : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
quo_dec : forall a b : nat, divides a b -> {q : nat | a = b * q}
quotient_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat
remainder_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat
bezout_exists_prod : forall x : nat * nat, {y : nat * nat | is_gcd (fst y * fst x - snd y * snd x) (fst x) (snd x)} + {y : nat * nat | is_gcd (snd y * snd x - fst y * fst x) (fst x) (snd x)}
prime_cond : forall p : nat, p <> 1 /\ (forall a : nat, a <> 1 -> a <> p -> ~ divides p a) < -> is_prime p
gcd_exists_prod : forall x : nat * nat, {d : nat | is_gcd d (fst x) (snd x)}
gcd_exists_prod_bis : forall x : nat * nat, {d : nat | is_gcd d (fst x) (snd x)}
plus_is_one : forall m n : nat, m + n = 1 -> {m = 0 /\ n = 1} + {m = 1 /\ n = 0}
lt_wf_rec : forall (n : nat) (P : nat -> Set), (forall n0 : nat, (forall m : nat, m < n0 -> P m) -> P n0) -> P n
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => 0%Z | S n0 => Z.pos (Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
BinNatDef.N.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => 0%N | S n' => N.pos (Pos.of_succ_nat n') end : nat -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.of_nat _%nat_scope
power_plus_lemma1 : forall n m x : nat, power x (n + m) = power x n * power x m
fast_OMEGA16 : forall (v c l k : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (v * (c * k) + l * k)%Z -> P ((v * c + l) * k)%Z

``` 
intros n l H1 H2. 
destruct n. 
- left. exists 0. reflexivity.
- right. exists O, (S n), O, O. split; [|split; [|split; [|split; [|split]]].
  + apply nat_factor_prime. 
    * auto. 
    * lia. 
  + lia. 
  + lia. 
  + reflexivity. 
  + auto.
```

original: intros n l H1 H2. destruct n. - left. exists 0. reflexivity. - right. exists O, (S n), O, O.
